flavor_text: Swift Revenant Spawn|These fast-moving worm-like creatures have several rows of sharp teeth.,<N><N>Eyewitness accounts speak of them bursting from large, bloated Revenant that have festered for weeks.
Reanimated Corpse|In the pit, corpses often rise again several days after death.<N><N>These monsters are known as <LQ>Revenant,<RQ> meaning, <LQ>Those who Return.<RQ>
The <LQ>Cult of the Blood-Mad<RQ> began with a nomadic sect known for ceremonial blood-letting.
These accounts are from survivors of the Geka tribe massacre. Many report cultists transforming into Revenant at will.

<RE>[$EN_CULTIST_SECT_FLAVOR_TEXT]<N><N>Little is known about their worship or beliefs beyond the name of their deity, <LQ>Eztli-Tenoch,<RQ> and their constant hunt for fresh victims.<N><N><RE>[$EN_CULTIST_ACCOUNT_FLAVOR_TEXT]

Cultist Priest|<RE>[$EN_CULTIST_SECT_FLAVOR_TEXT]<N><N>Acts of ritualistic violence are carried out by cultist priests, who often exhibit extensive self-mutilation.<N><N><RE>[$EN_CULTIST_ACCOUNT_FLAVOR_TEXT]

Cultist High Priest|<RE>[$EN_CULTIST_SECT_FLAVOR_TEXT]<N><N>Some Quaid historical records claim the cult was organized under a matriarchal office termed the <LQ>Queen of Many Devils.<RQ> This central power structure appears to have vanished in recent centuries in favor of a looser assembly of high priests.
Swimming Revenant|These Revenant exude a sticky slime that water-proofs their body.<N><N>Noxious gases fill their abdomen, which keeps them from sinking
Armored Revenant|These Revenant were once knights that fell in battle.<N><N>Although they retain none of the intelligence and skill they had in life, they still retain their armor.

Swift Revenant Spawn|These fast-moving worm-like creatures have several rows of sharp teeth.<N><N>Eyewitnesses accounts speak of them bursting out of large, bloated Revenant that have festered for weeks.
Swift Swimming Spawn|Some say these swimming worm-Revenant split off from buoyant human Revenant.<N><N>Others suggest they grew from the corpses of fish and river snakes.
Swift Armored Spawn|These worm-Revenant have developed a thick carapace.<N><N>Many theorize that the armored shell is composed of bone digested from the original corpse.
Swift Armored Swimming Spawn|These swimming worm-Revenant have developed both an armored carapace and the ability to swim.<N><N>The smell of digested bone and noxious gas is overpowering.
Fighting Revenant|Some Revenant are more aggressive than others.<N><N>Whereas normal Revenant single-mindedly stalk a single victim, these are known to attack everything in sight.

Dark Fighting Revenant|The gases that build up in a Revenant's abdomen escape through pores in the skin, surrounding the creature in a noxious cloud of dense, overpowering smoke that both obscures it from view and confuses its victims.
Fighting Swimming Revenant|Tales of stinking corpses rising from the water and attacking thirsty villagers abound in the pit.<N><N>No one fetches water alone, and only the mad dare to swim.
Fighting Armored Revenant|These fallen knights are both vicious and strong.<N><N>Their unearthly cries echo through the catacombs and across the wasteland.
Spawn Host|These bloated corpses can barely move and look ready to pop at any moment.<N><N>Several mouths filled with teeth sprout from their sides. They are also too big to knock back or devour.
Swimming Spawn Host|These Revenant smell like a sack of rotten fish wrapped in sewage and death.<N><N>They float easily, and look ready to pop at any moment.
Armored Spawn Host|A giant carapace protects this monstrous blob of digested flesh.<N><N>One suspects it has no bones left at all.
Splitting Spawn Host|This strange monster is discolored as well as bloated.<N><N>What could it mean?
As the weeks go on, some strange process starts to digest and warp the body of the Revenant.<N><N>Witnesses report being attacked by eyeless <LQ>snake-men<RQ> spewing rank bile.
Swift Dark Spawn|These worms are shrouded in a thick black mist that make them nearly impossible to hit.

Tough Revenant Spawn|These pale and worm-like creatures move slowly, and feature tough, leathery skin instead of a fragile outer membrane.<N><N>Although easily outrun, they usually overcome their prey through relentless, unending pursuit.
I Am Error|If you're reading this it means that someone probably has a typo in the enemy data. This is the enemy we show when the intended one can't be found

Delicious Mammal|Dragons can go for years without eating, but when they do feed can consume many times their body weight in a single day.  This fact is a source of great discomfort to nomadic shepherds and their flocks.

Swift Delicious Mammal|Certain sheep have adapted to the hostile conditions in the pit with highly developed fast-twitch muscles.  This is of no use in outrunning dragons, but does allow them to at least outrun the other sheep.

Mythically Delicious Mammal|Dragon legends speak of this rare sheep, the Axxima Vatta Muttanaxxor, in hushed, reverent tones, and the sacred Dragon scriptures detail an elaborate ritual to be performed at its arrival.  Traditional scholarship groups the Dragon scriptures with other religious texts, but new research suggests it be re-classified as a cookbook.
Revenant Slave|The once great Warlord of the Pit, now nothing more than Zelemir's mindless minion.<N>His robe's still pretty snazzy, though.
Revenant Brother|BLARGH YAAAARGH GAR GAR HUR.
Monstrous Finger|Although severed from its hand, this finger moves of its own accord.
Monstrous Thumb|Although severed from its hand, this thumb moves of its own accord.
Monstrous Finger|This severed finger seems to be making an obscene gesture. How Rude!
Monstrous Eye|This malevolent eye glows with dark power and moves with an unnatural swiftness.

Monstrous Hand|The cultist leader called this monster the <LQ>The Right Hand of Eztli-Tenoch.<RQ> Given how little is known about Eztli-Tenoch, it is unclear whether this is really the dread wizard's own hand or merely a creation of his dark magic. On closer inspection, it seems to be a LEFT hand. How sinister.
Necromantic Sorceror|Zelemir's eyes glow with resolute determination.

Ancient Legendary Wizard|An ancient force, long slumbering, now awakened. Eztli-Tenoch once ruled the known world as self-proclaimed God-King. His power and malevolence are outmatched only by his unflinching patience.
